titleStmt.title: Two sticks made one, or, The excellency of unity being a sermon preached by the appointment of the Congregational and Presbyterian perswasion at their happy union on the sixth day of April, 1691, which was a day set apart by them, partly to bewail former divisions and partly as a thanksgiving to God for Their present agreement and now at their unamimous request made publick / by Matthew Mead ...
titleStmt.author: Mead, Matthew, 1630?-1699.

titleStmt.title: Two sticks made one, or, The excellency of unity being a sermon preached by the appointment of the Congregational and Presbyterian perswasion at their happy union on the sixth day of April, 1691, which was a day set apart by them, partly to bewail former divisions and partly as a thanksgiving to God for Their present agreement and now at their unamimous request made publick / by Matthew Mead ...
titleStmt.author: Mead, Matthew, 1630?-1699.

notesStmt.note: Dedication: "To the Reverend the dissenting ministers of London, formerly called Congregational and Presbyterian, but now known by the name of United Brethren."
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
